title: compiler schema version 1.0
description: The compiler schema is of ``type: compiler`` in sub-schema which is used for compiling and running programs

type.description: Select schema type to use when validating buildspec. This must be of set to ``compiler``

description.description: The ``description`` field is used to document what the test is doing

module.description: A list of modules to load into test script

build.description: The ``build`` section is used for compiling a single program, this section specifies fields for setting C, C++, Fortran compiler and flags including CPP flags and linker flags

name.description: Select the compiler class to use, buildtest will set cc, cxx, and fc compiler wrapper based on compiler name

cc.description: Set C compiler. Use this field to override buildtest selection for **cc**

fc.description: Set Fortran compiler. Use this field to override buildtest selection for **fc**

cxx.description: Set C++ compiler. Use this field to override buildtest selection for **cxx**

source.description: Specify a source file for compilation, the file can be relative path to buildspec or an absolute path

run.description: The ``run`` section is used for specifying launch configuration of executable

launcher.description: The ``launcher`` field is inserted before the executable. This can be used when running programs with ``mpirun``, ``mpiexec``, ``srun``, etc... You may specify launcher options with this field

args.description: The ``args`` field is used to specify arguments to executable.
